href.Description: Rising temperatures lead to an increase in the frequency and intensity of heatwaves, which pose significant risks to humans. Prolonged exposure to extreme heat can lead to a range of health issues, including heatstroke, dehydration, respiratory problems, and exacerbation of existing conditions. Vulnerable populations, such as the elderly, children, and those with preexisting health concerns, are particularly at risk.
href.Title: Heat
href.description: Climate change increases the frequency and intensity of hot spells and heatwaves, which pose significant risks to humans. Prolonged exposure to extreme heat can cause dehydration, heatstroke, and exacerbation of existing conditions. Vulnerable populations, such as the elderly, children, and those with heart, kidney, respiratory diseases or mental health concerns, are particularly at risk.
href.title: Heat

4f456059-23d7-40f9-98e9-ea268e6887e6.description: Rising temperatures and extreme weather increases the transmission risk of vector-, water-, and food-borne diseases by altering the geographic ranges of vectors and hosts, promoting pathogen growth in water and food, and potentially impacting food system safety and yields.

href.Description: Rising temperatures and extreme weather increases the transmission risk of vector-, water-, and food-borne diseases by altering the geographic ranges of vectors and hosts, promoting pathogen growth in water and food, and potentially impacting food system safety and yields.
href.Title: Infectious diseases
href.description: Climate change expands the range and risk of vector-borne diseases by altering temperature, rainfall, and humidity, which affects the life cycles of vectors like mosquitoes and ticks. It also increases the risk of waterborne diseases by promoting the growth of pathogens in contaminated water, especially during periods of heavy rainfall and drought.
href.title: Infectious diseases

4f456059-23d7-40f9-98e9-ea268e6887e6.title: Infectious diseases

href.Description: Flooding poses serious physical and mental health risks, including drowning, injuries, and infectious diseases from contaminated water. Vulnerable groups like children, the elderly, and chronically ill are especially at risk.  Climate change is projected to increase flood exposure across Europe.
href.Title: Flooding
href.description: Flooding poses serious health risks, including drowning, injuries, and infectious diseases from contaminated water. It also causes mental trauma. Vulnerable groups like children, the elderly, and chronically ill are especially at risk. Climate change is projected to increase flood exposure across Europe.
href.title: Flooding

a971811f-cd5e-4028-a027-bff438b5d624.description: Climate change impacts mental health, especially among vulnerable populations. Extreme weather, heat, and environmental changes contribute to anxiety, trauma, and PTSD. Mental health impacts remain underexplored compared to physical health, despite growing exposure risks.

href.Description: Climate change impacts mental health, especially among vulnerable populations. Extreme weather, heat, and environmental changes contribute to anxiety, trauma, and PTSD. Mental health impacts remain underexplored compared to physical health, despite growing exposure risks.
href.Title: Mental health
href.description: Climate change impacts mental health, especially among vulnerable populations. Extreme weather causes trauma, often with longer-term implications, whilst concern about ongoing climate change may develop into eco-anxiety. Mental health impacts remain underexplored compared to physical health.
href.title: Mental health

a971811f-cd5e-4028-a027-bff438b5d624.title: Mental health
